intro: Pseudognaphalium lanuginosum, commonly known as the woolly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features soft, hairy stems and leaves, which give it a fuzzy appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that are surrounded by white or pale pink ray florets. Pseudognaphalium lanuginosum is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
